November 8

Update-Workshop integration for the Circuits Composer

We have made an update to our Circuits Composer,

now everyone can upload their own songs to the workshop and also their own sounds to being used into de composer. And also everyone can download the others sounds and songs to use it on the composer.

here we created a little guide to help you understanding how to use this new feature :

The Steam workshop and the circuits composer 
A Guide for Circuits
By: Tentacle
This guide describe the different steps to both upload and download content from the steam workshop to the Circuits Composer Game.



Please if you have any question let us know.

Now you can go to the workshop tab on the circuits community hub and suscribe to the items you want. They will automatically download and will be ready to use in the next composer launch.

Regards,
Digital Tentacle.

About This Game

Simple in concept, but very challenging and rewarding, Circuits is a musical puzzle game that requires careful listening to complete each level.

The goal of Circuits


piece together the different parts of a song. Sounds easy, but maybe not.

As we love music, we wanted to make a game that gives the player an insight into how music is created and makes listening the core part of the experience. Packed with beautifullly designed minimal graphics, to not disturb the focus of the game, and right now 25 different songs for the player to reconstruct.

So if you like music, you will like Circuits .

Features


  • Engaging gameplay that gives an insight into music creation for players
  • A soundtrack mix of electronic ambient,dubstep, and epic orchestra composed by David García ( Deadlight, Rime...)
  • Beautiful minimal design
  • And a Turbo.
READ MORE

8 of 8 people (100%) found this review helpful
Kuebic
286 products in account
16 reviews
Recommended
3.3 hrs on record
Posted: July 1
Definitely an interesting musical experience fuzed with minimalistic interface. Depending on the player's musical ear will determine the puzzle's difficulty. I would recommend this game for anyone that appreciates musical composition and eloquent ear training puzzles.

Edit: The Circuits Composer mode was a free update and essentially an entirely different branch of this game. For those that like the music from Circuits, now they can take sound bytes (either from the game or just similar sounds from the game's composer) and piece them together with a simple yet limited GUI. This is probalby the equivilance of what Windows Movie Maker is in the video editing world. Although limited, it's pretty easy to create some simple electronic ambient background music.

If musical puzzles or simple electronic music creation is what you want, I'd recommend Circuits a go.

Circuits is all about making, or rather, recreating music. By listening to the various layers the song contains you replicate them by using those same sounds. It's cheap, it's simple, it's relaxing. And it now contains an actual composer. Recommended!

=T$ETag= SergeantMiyagi
244 products in account
28 reviews
Recommended
4.4 hrs on record
Posted: September 11
Circuits is a simplistic musical puzzle game that requires careful listening to complete each level.
The concept is pretty simple and unique, and the objective is to simply listen to a full sequence of a song and compose it piece by piece as it gets more complex with the player's progression.
Although the simplistic concept, the game manages to keep the player engaged and entertained by introducing new methods of completing increasingly difficult sequences of songs.
Overall, Circuits offers an immersing and epic musical experience and I highly recommend it.
